1.name: EXIT_FAILURE
1.context: Use when no more specific exit code applies

10.name: EXIT_PORT_IN_USE
10.description: Specified port is already in use
10.context: Server startup when port unavailable and fail_if_unavailable strategy

11.name: EXIT_PORT_RANGE_EXHAUSTED
11.description: No available ports in configured range
11.context: Server startup when all ports in environment range occupied

12.name: EXIT_INSTANCE_ALREADY_RUNNING
12.description: Another instance already running on target port
12.context: Server startup when PID registry shows active process on port

13.name: EXIT_NETWORK_UNREACHABLE
13.context: Client connections, health checks, external service validation

14.name: EXIT_CONNECTION_REFUSED
14.context: Database connections, API endpoints, upstream services

15.name: EXIT_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT
15.context: Slow networks, unresponsive services, firewall blocks

20.name: EXIT_CONFIG_INVALID
20.context: Startup validation, schema mismatches, invalid YAML/JSON

21.name: EXIT_MISSING_DEPENDENCY
21.context: Missing binaries, libraries, or runtime requirements

22.name: EXIT_SSOT_VERSION_MISMATCH
22.context: Helper library detects unsupported Crucible version

23.name: EXIT_CONFIG_FILE_NOT_FOUND
23.context: Explicitly specified config path doesn't exist

24.name: EXIT_ENVIRONMENT_INVALID
24.context: Unknown environment name, missing environment config

30.name: EXIT_HEALTH_CHECK_FAILED
30.description: Health check endpoint returned non-healthy status

31.name: EXIT_DATABASE_UNAVAILABLE
31.context: Startup connection checks, critical query failures

32.name: EXIT_EXTERNAL_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE
32.context: API dependencies, message queues, cache servers

33.name: EXIT_RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED
33.description: System resources exhausted (memory, disk, file descriptors)
33.context: Out-of-memory, disk full, too many open files

34.name: EXIT_OPERATION_TIMEOUT
34.context: Long-running tasks, async operations, batch processing

40.name: EXIT_INVALID_ARGUMENT
40.description: Invalid command-line argument or flag value
40.context: Type errors, out-of-range values, malformed input

50.name: EXIT_PERMISSION_DENIED
50.context: File access, port binding (<1024), privileged operations

51.name: EXIT_FILE_NOT_FOUND
51.context: Assets, templates, data files (not config - use 23)

52.name: EXIT_DIRECTORY_NOT_FOUND
52.context: State directories, log paths, data directories

53.name: EXIT_FILE_READ_ERROR
53.context: Corrupt files, I/O errors, encoding issues

54.name: EXIT_FILE_WRITE_ERROR
54.context: Disk full, read-only filesystem, permission errors

62.name: EXIT_TRANSFORMATION_FAILED
62.context: Type conversions, format transformations, encoding changes

64.name: EXIT_USAGE
64.context: BSD sysexits.h EX_USAGE - wrong number of arguments, bad syntax

70.name: EXIT_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED
70.context: Invalid credentials, expired tokens, auth service unavailable

71.name: EXIT_AUTHORIZATION_FAILED
71.context: RBAC failures, scope violations, resource access denied

72.name: EXIT_SECURITY_VIOLATION
72.context: Suspicious activity, rate limit exceeded, IP blocklist

73.name: EXIT_CERTIFICATE_INVALID
73.context: Expired certs, untrusted CAs, hostname mismatches

80.name: EXIT_METRICS_UNAVAILABLE
80.description: Metrics endpoint or collection system unavailable
80.context:
Use for observability-focused tools (Prometheus exporters, StatsD agents).
Workhorses SHOULD log warning and continue unless configured to fail-fast.

81.name: EXIT_TRACING_FAILED
81.context: OTLP exporter failed, Jaeger collector unreachable

82.name: EXIT_LOGGING_FAILED
82.context: Log aggregator unreachable, log file unwritable

83.name: EXIT_ALERT_SYSTEM_FAILED
83.context: PagerDuty API failed, Slack webhook unreachable

84.name: EXIT_STRUCTURED_LOGGING_FAILED
84.context: JSON log aggregator unreachable, log schema validation failed

91.name: EXIT_TEST_FAILURE
91.context:
Test assertions failed, expected behavior not met.
Maps to pytest exit code 1, Go test failure, Jest failure.

92.name: EXIT_TEST_ERROR
92.context:
Test setup failed, fixture unavailable, test harness error.
Maps to pytest exit code 3 (internal error).

93.name: EXIT_TEST_INTERRUPTED
93.description: Test run interrupted by user or system
93.context:
Ctrl+C during tests, system signal, user cancellation.
Maps to pytest exit code 2.

94.name: EXIT_TEST_USAGE_ERROR
94.context:
Invalid test arguments, bad configuration.
Maps to pytest exit code 4.

95.name: EXIT_TEST_NO_TESTS_COLLECTED
95.description: No tests found or all tests skipped
95.context:
Empty test suite, all tests deselected or skipped.
Maps to pytest exit code 5.

96.name: EXIT_COVERAGE_THRESHOLD_NOT_MET
96.context: Code coverage validation, quality gate failure

129.name: EXIT_SIGNAL_HUP
129.description: Hangup signal (SIGHUP) - config reload via restart
129.context:
Config reload via restart-based pattern (mandatory schema validation).
Process exits with 129, supervisor restarts with new config.
See signals.yaml for reload behavior definition.

130.name: EXIT_SIGNAL_INT
130.description: Interrupt signal (SIGINT) - user interrupt with Ctrl+C double-tap
130.context:
Ctrl+C pressed. First tap initiates graceful shutdown, second within 2s forces immediate exit.
Same exit code (130) for both graceful and force modes.
See signals.yaml for double-tap behavior definition.

131.name: EXIT_SIGNAL_QUIT
131.context:
Ctrl+\ on Unix, Ctrl+Break on Windows. Immediate termination without cleanup.
Use for emergency shutdown or debugging (core dumps).

138.name: EXIT_SIGNAL_USR1
138.context:
Application-specific signal (e.g., reopen logs, dump stats, trigger profiling).
Applications register custom handlers. Exit code 138 on Linux (128+10).
Platform differences: macOS/FreeBSD use signal 30 (exit 158), not 10.

140.name: EXIT_SIGNAL_USR2
140.context:
Application-specific signal (e.g., toggle debug mode, rotate credentials).
Applications register custom handlers. Exit code 140 on Linux (128+12).
Platform differences: macOS/FreeBSD use signal 31 (exit 159), not 12.

141.name: EXIT_SIGNAL_PIPE
141.context:
Writing to closed pipe/socket. Fulmen default is observe_only (log + graceful exit).
Applications may override to ignore for network services.
See signals.yaml for SIGPIPE handling guidance.

142.name: EXIT_SIGNAL_ALRM
142.context:
Watchdog timer expired. Treat as timeout-induced exit.
Watchdog pattern out of scope for v1.0.0 module implementations.
142.python_note: Supported by signal module, rarely used in practice

143.name: EXIT_SIGNAL_TERM
143.context:
Graceful shutdown requested by container orchestrator or process supervisor.
Standard 30-second timeout for cleanup. Applications run cleanup handlers before exit.
See signals.yaml for graceful shutdown behavior definition.
